Legal_Issue: Whether the assessment officer correctly applied Rule 420 to double costs due to an unrevoked settlement offer
Decision_Outcome: Assessment officer's decision to double costs upheld
Legal_Rule: Rule 420 allows doubling of costs if a written, unrevoked settlement offer achieves a better result for the plaintiff than at trial
Standard_of_Review: No error in principle or unreasonable result
Procedural_Issue: Challenge to costs assessment based on Rule 420
Grounds_for_Claim: Plaintiff's dissatisfaction with costs assessed after unsuccessful litigation and dismissal of case
Outcome_on_Merits: Action dismissed with costs awarded to defendants
Review_Standard: No error in principle or unreasonableness
Key_Evidence_Considered: Unrevoked settlement offer made by defendants in 2001
Applicant_Challenge: Challenge to application of Rule 420 in costs assessment
Court_Result: Motion dismissed; costs awarded to defendants
Defendant_Response: Settlement offer not accepted; action dismissed with costs
Resolution_Mechanism: Administrative costs assessment and judicial review
Grounds_for_Inadmissibility_or_Allegatio: Unsuccessful litigation and dismissal of case
Applicable_Process: Costs assessment and motion for review
